00027 Recognizer::Recognizer (const std::string &path) : texts_(std::vector<Text>(0)), statistics_(std::vector<Statistics>(0))
00028 {
00029     // Load image from disk
00030     std::vector<Magick::Image> images;
00031     Magick::readImages( &images, path );
00032     
00033     Magick::Image image = images[0];
00034     
00035     // Store the image dimensions
00036     width_  = image.columns();
00037     height_ = image.rows();
00038     
00039     // Load image into the internal vector
00040     loadImage(image);
00041 };

00073 void Recognizer::obtainText ()
00074 {

00111 void Recognizer::obtainText (const unsigned int &x, const unsigned int &y, unsigned int &height, unsigned int &width)
00112 {
00113     // Test the upper left-most pixel X coordinate is inside the source image
00114     if ( (x >= height_) or (x < 0) )
00115         throw NessieException ("Recognizer::obtainText() : The x coordinate of the clip's top left-most pixel is outside the image");
00116         
00117     // Test the upper left-most pixel Y coordinate is inside the source image
00118     if ( (y >= width_) or (y < 0) )
00119         throw NessieException ("Recognizer::obtainText() : The y coordinate of the clip's top left-most pixel is outside the image");
00120     
00121     // Test the clip's height is not bigger than the image
00122     if ( (height > height_) or (height < 0) )
00123         throw NessieException ("Recognizer::obtainText() : The height of the clip is bigger than the image's height or less than 0");
00124         
00125     // Test the clip's width is not bigger than the image
00126     if ( (width > width_) or (width < 0) )
00127         throw NessieException ("Recognizer::obtainText() : The width of the clip is bigger than the image's width or less than 0");
00128         
00129     // Truncate the clip's height if it is outside the source image
00130     if ((x + height) > height_)
00131         height = height_ - x;
00132     
00133     // Truncate the clip's width if it is outside the source image
00134     if ((y + width) > width_)
00135         width = width_ - y;
00136     
00137     // Creates the clip
00138     Clip clip(image_, x, y, height, width);
00139     
00140     
00141     // Preprocessing stage
00142     Preprocessor preprocessor;
00143     preprocessor.computeOptimalThreshold(clip);
00144     preprocessor.removeIsolatedNoise(clip);
00145     updateImage(clip);
00146     
00147     
00148     // Segmentation stage
00149     
00150     
00151     // Classification stage
00152 };

00167 void Recognizer::writeExternalImage (Magick::Image &externalImage) const
00168 {
00169     unsigned int rows = height_, columns = width_;
00170     
00171     // Test if the image is empty to create a new one
00172     if ( (externalImage.rows() == 0) and (externalImage.columns() == 0) )
00173         externalImage = Magick::Image(Magick::Geometry(width_, height_), "white");
00174     
00175     // Test if the external image fits into the current image
00176     if ( externalImage.rows() < height_ )
00177         rows = externalImage.rows();
00178     
00179     if ( externalImage.columns() < width_ )
00180         columns = externalImage.columns();
00181     
00182     // Convert the image into a grayscale colorspace
00183     externalImage.type( Magick::GrayscaleType );
00184     
00185     // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image
00186     // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00187     externalImage.modifyImage();
00188         
00189     // Copy the current data into the external image
00190     for ( unsigned int i = 0; i < rows; ++i )
00191     {
00192         for ( unsigned int j = 0; j < columns; ++j )
00193         {
00194             unsigned int index = (i * columns) + j;
00195             
00196             Magick::ColorGray color;
00197             color.shade(static_cast<double>(image_[index]) / 255.0);
00198             externalImage.pixelColor(j, i, color);
00199         }
00200     }
00201     
00202     // Save changes to image.
00203     externalImage.syncPixels();
00204 };

00220 void Recognizer::loadImage (Magick::Image &image)
00221 {
00222     // Convert the image into grayscale colorspace
00223     image.type( Magick::GrayscaleType );
00224     
00225     // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image
00226     // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00227     image.modifyImage();
00228     
00229     // Copy the image into the internal data structure
00230     image_.reserve(height_ * width_);
00231     for ( unsigned int i = 0; i < height_; ++i )
00232     {
00233         for ( unsigned int j = 0; j < width_; ++j )
00234         {
00235             Magick::ColorGray grayLevel = image.pixelColor(j, i);
00236             
00237             image_.push_back( static_cast<unsigned char>(round(grayLevel.shade() * 255.0)) );
00238         }
00239     }   
00240 };

00254 void Recognizer::updateImage (const Clip &clip)
00255 {
00256     unsigned int p = 0, q;
00257     for ( unsigned int i = clip.x(); i < clip.height(); ++i )
00258     {
00259         q = 0;
00260         for ( unsigned int j = clip.y(); j < clip.width(); ++j )
00261         {
00262             image_[(i * width_) + j] = clip.getPixelGrayLevel(p, q++);
00263         }
00264         p++;
00265     }
00266 };
